title: Digital Competency Enhancement Project for Undergraduate Scientific Research

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Students require systematic training to effectively utilize digital tools in academic settings, with learning conducted in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments. Emphasis on digital competencies linked to real scientific research through project execution.

learning_goals: Students can independently utilize smartphone-based digital tools (e.g., Google Sheets, data collection apps) for scientific research data collection, analysis, and visualization
Learners can effectively operate collaboration tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Drive) in PBL team projects to complete scientific research projects
Students can select credible online resources for scientific research reports based on digital information evaluation and critical analysis skills

resources: Free Data Analysis/Visualization Apps (Plotly, RAWGraphs, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
